text:
1st time to try the food from this shop and it’s a totally sad experience. The cream chicken and the pork ribs we ordered are both very dry and chewy.  Food tastes like reheated/recooked. They both have a burnt and salty taste. There’s no wok hei taste at all. The price of the meal is not worth it. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS. BUY AT YOUR OWN RISK. one star for the staff.

I will recommend the Tze Char at the corner of Punggol Rd and compassvale street. Their food is worth the price.

Despite the negative reviews I still came and tried it out.

Been here alot of times to eat the chicken rice and I have always been tempted by the smell of the wok hei when some uncle ordered hor fun.

Service is pretty fast as opposed to what other reviewers are stating. I got my 9 dollar medium plate of hor fun within 10 to 15 mins.

The wok hei is definitely on point and I felt that the ingredients are pretty lacklustre. For places that uses real seafood I am expecting the hor fun to be at least 10 or 12 dollars for a small to medium portion.

If you like your hor fun to be packed filled with wok hei then this is the place to go.
Many low reviews for service. But food quality is good. We ordered via grab. The stingray is our favourite. Pork rib rice is good too.

never seen such a pathetic mui fan before. literally rice, fishcake, sauce, 3 piece of pork and it is tasteless. this kind of standard come out and do tze char might as well eat porridge. ordered sweet & sour fish rice they tell me i ordered without rice charge me $13 but they packed sweet & sour rice portion for me what a scam. do not recommend dining here getting from bad to worse

The food is nice and the portion is big.
Price is very reasonable. But sometimes need to wait quite long
